member.summary: Iterates through collection of dependent object types and where conditions and select all objects that satisfy at least one condition. Executes passed action on all objects. Selected objects are passed to grouped by their type.
member.remarks: may be executed multiple times even with objects of the same type. When number of where conditions for given type exceeds internal limit, then conditions are split into multiple queries. That means that objects of the same type are not always served altogether in one action call.
member.param: Collection of object types and where conditions that selects dependent objects.
Action that is executed for all objects that satisfy the where condition. Objects are grouped by type in one action call.

member.name: P:CMS.ContinuousIntegration.Internal.AbstractFileSystemJob.TranslationHelper
member.summary: Provides object translation. Used in serialization to optimize database calls.
member.remarks: The property contains data records that correspond with the database. For translation records identified using partially correct parameters (either the code name or GUID is different than the value in the database), the actual values are loaded from the database for all fields. An index key referencing the correct data is then created from the partial parameters. The index key is used to obtain the record in future calls.

member.name: T:CMS.ContinuousIntegration.Internal.RepositoryLocationsCollection
member.summary: Class represents collection of file locations in the repository that are all used for deserialization of one object.
member.remarks: Serialization of common info object results in single location stored in the collection (path to its XML file). Collection might contain multiple if the serialized object is wrapper (e.g. document). Once an object defines non-empty , single main location will contain multiple locations for these separated will. Separated fields of a serialized info object can be found in collection.

member.summary: Gets file system safe representation of . The resulting name does not exceed characters in length. must accommodate and delimiting character.

Max length of the resulting name.
Number of hash characters to be included in the resulting name, if hashing is needed.

member.summary: Manages file system repository for continuous integration - stores and restores supported objects to and from the repository. Ensures mutual exclusion of the repository access across processes.

Members of this class are thread-safe.

Repository root path

member.name: M:CMS.ContinuousIntegration.FileSystemRepositoryManager.IsStoreAllRunningGlobally(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)

summary.para: Indicates whether the storing of all objects is running or not. The method tries to speculatively acquire the global mutex to determine whether storing is running and releases it immediately unless is true.
This method modifies the mutex state by speculatively acquiring it.

member.returns: True if storing of all objects is running, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CMS.ContinuousIntegration.FileSystemRepositoryManager.IsRestoreAllRunningGlobally(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)

summary.para: Indicates whether the restoring of all objects is running or not. The method tries to speculatively acquire the global mutex to determine whether restoring is running and releases it immediately unless is true.
This method modifies the mutex state by speculatively acquiring it.

member.returns: True if storing of all objects is running, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CMS.ContinuousIntegration.RepositoryHashManager.LoadFilesMetadataFromDatabase(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Loads s from DB and stores retrieved hashes within .
Hashes of file paths that are not stored in the DB are preserved.
Hashes of file paths that are not stored in the are appended.
Hashes of file paths stored in the DB overwrite the ones that eventually exist within provided is set to true (otherwise original hash is preserved and record is marked for update).
member.param: If true, existing hashes are overwritten by data loaded from DB, otherwise, the distinct hashes are preserved and marked for update.
If true, only hashes of file paths that are stored in the are loaded from DB, otherwise all hashes are loaded.

member.name: M:CMS.ContinuousIntegration.RepositoryHashManager.UpdateFilesMetadataInDatabase(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Stores relative file locations and the files' hashes in the database using .
New hashes are added to the DB. Removed hashes are deleted from the DB. Amended hashes are updated in the DB.
member.param: If true, only metadata that are stored in the are updated, otherwise all hashes are processed. Use true for update after single object operation, false for mass operation (Store all, Restore all)
